On Thu, 22 May 2003, Tim Sawyer <tim@...> wrote:

> So one test is working and the other not.  I find it odd that it's
> finding the class in the directory (I'm using <batchtest> in ant)
> yet then gives a ClassNotFound error, even though it must have found
> the class file to know to run the test.  (Classpath?)

Certainly a classpath issue, yes.

<batchtest> and your <classpath> have no relation to each other at
all.  I prefer to use <batchtest> on my sources instead of the
compiled classes for example.

For Ant to be able to run your tests, the corresponding classes must
be in the classpath of the task - either via the task's <classpath>
element or via your CLASSPATH environment variable.

Stefan

BTW

>>           <classpath>
>>              <pathelement location="${classpath}" />
>>           </classpath>

could cause all sorts of problems if the property classpath doesn't
point to a single archive or directory.  The location attribute does
not split its value into pieces but assumes it is a file-system
object.

Use the path attribute if you want to use a pre-existing path.
